page.title: 05Standing Stones Beetham.
page.content: The story goes that the stones were dropped by the devil. He was building the Devils Bridge at Kirkby Lonsdale using stone from Witherslack Quarry. He could only carry three stones in his apron. St Micheal who lived in a cell in Beetham churchyard was disturbed from his afternoon snooze by all this flying.He shook his fist at the devil and said some rather unholy words for a man of the cloth.The devil was so alarmed that he shot up into the air causing his apron strings to break and his apron to drop.The stones fell into the nearby field. Some village boys saw what happened and recounted the tale.
